title-group.article-title: ON THE INTEGERS OF THE FORM p 2 + b 2 + 2 n AND ${\mathrm{b}}_{1}^{2}+{\mathrm{b}}_{2}^{2}+{2}^{{\mathrm{n}}^{2}}$

abstract.p: We prove that the sumset {p 2 + b 2 + 2 n : p is prime and b, n ∈ ℕ} has positive lower density. We also construct a residue class with an odd modulus that contains no integer of the form p 2 + b 2 + 2 n . Similar results are established for the sumset $\{{\mathrm{b}}_{1}^{2}+{\mathrm{b}}_{2}^{2}+{2}^{{\mathrm{n}}^{2}}:{\mathrm{b}}_{1},{\mathrm{b}}_{2},\mathrm{n}\in \mathrm{\mathbb{N}}\}$
